author: gsweet
title: Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino hails Hugo Lloris, Dele Alli, Eric Dier, Harry Kane and Christian Eriksen – his team of leaders
text:
Comments MAURICIO POCHETTINO is not worried about the leaders — and he does not mean Chelsea. 
The Tottenham boss takes his second-placed side to face Liverpool on Saturday looking to close the nine-point gap on pace-setting Blues. PA:Press Association 6 Mauricio Pochettino…has leaders throughout the team 
But while Kop boss Jurgen Klopp has been accused of having no generals in his Anfield squad, Poch has no such worries. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Tottenham news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
The Argentine said: “For me, every player here has the quality and capacity to be a leader for us. 
“Our captain Hugo Lloris is also the captain of France. 
“We have other players who have worn the armband for us this season — and even more who have the potential to do so in the future. Getty Images Keeper Hugo Lloris is the captain of France Getty Images 6 Pochettino says Dele Alli has all the credentials to become a good captain 
“Dele Alli is one who has the personality and character to maybe become our leader in a few years. All of our players have leadership qualities, they just need time to develop them.” 
Keeper Lloris has skippered Spurs 27 times in all competitions this term. 
England stars Eric Dier and Harry Kane have each led the team on three occasions and Danish midfielder Christian Eriksen once. Saturday Premier League match preview featuring Liverpool v Tottenham 
Poch added: “It is important to have good characters who always work to win, not just say, ‘I want to win’. 
“You have to also show you want it with your behaviour and attitude. 
“Enthusiasm is important, it is your own motivation. 
“If you have character and good personality you are a leader, it’s a natural quality. “I am now very happy with our players’ personalities and the way they behave in the changing room, plus our performances are good. 
“We can win or lose — but I am still very happy.” 
Tottenham boast the best defensive record in the top flight, having conceded just 16 goals in their 24 Premier League matches this term. 
Pochettino said: “It’s all down to team work. Football is a collective thing. 
“It’s not only 11 players, it’s 25 players and those 25 need to be always ready to fight. Getty Images Eric Dier has filled in as the Tottenham captain Getty Images 6 And so, too, has England striker Harry Kane 
“It’s sometimes difficult for people to understand — but that is why managers give the opportunity to other players in different competitions. 
“You cannot only have 11 players all the time. 
“For me, they are not just a number, they are people who feel, who have emotions. 
“And it’s very tough when you cannot give them the possibility to play after they have trained hard all week. 
“And because they don’t play, they train harder than the other players.” Getty Images Christian Eriksen signs on the dotted line for Pochettino Middlesbrough keeper Victor Valdes and Tottenham star Dele Ali clash in an off the ball incident 
Pochettino will field his strongest possible line-up against Liverpool but is still without crocked defensive duo Jan Vertonghen and Danny Rose. 
And Poch revealed scans showed Rose did not suffer any ligament damage when he injured his knee at Sunderland last month. 
The manager still refused to put a timescale on the left-back’s return. 
Pochettino confirmed Steve Hitchen has returned as chief scout as part of a restructure of the club’s recruitment and analytical departments.
